definitions.meaning: 每年发生或进行一次的
definitions.usage: 形容某事定期在每年发生，通常与固定的活动、事件或周期性的事物相关。

examples.scene: 一家公司在年底召开全体员工大会，讨论过去一年的业绩和未来的计划。
examples.chineseIdea: 公司每年都会组织一次全体员工的会议，总结工作并规划未来。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The company holds an @ @ every December to review the year's performance.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The company holds an 「annual meeting」 every December to review the year's performance.
examples.chineseTranslation: 公司每年十二月举行一次「年度会议」以回顾全年的业绩。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：The company every year open a meeting. 纠正：The company holds an annual meeting every year.

examples.scene: 一家上市公司需要向股东提交一份详细的财务和运营总结。
examples.chineseIdea: 公司需要每年发布一份报告，说明财务状况和业务进展。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The corporation published its @ @ to shareholders last week.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The corporation published its 「annual report」 to shareholders last week.
examples.chineseTranslation: 该公司上周向股东发布了其「年度报告」。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：The company give report every year. 纠正：The company publishes its annual report every year.

definitions.meaning: 持续或计算为一年期的
definitions.usage: 描述某事物以年为单位计算或持续的时间，常用于财务、统计或生物学语境。

examples.scene: 一个人在填写税务申报表时，需要报告自己去年的总收入。
examples.chineseIdea: 需要计算并报告过去一年内的所有收入。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: She reported her @ @ on the tax form.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: She reported her 「annual income」 on the tax form.
examples.chineseTranslation: 她在税务表上报告了她的「年收入」。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：She wrote her every year money. 纠正：She reported her annual income.

examples.scene: 一个城市的气象部门发布了一份关于降雨量的年度统计数据。
examples.chineseIdea: 气象部门记录并公布了该地区一年的总降雨量。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The city recorded an @ @ of 1200 millimeters last year.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The city recorded an 「annual rainfall」 of 1200 millimeters last year.
examples.chineseTranslation: 该市去年记录了「年降雨量」为1200毫米。
examples.chinglishFix: 中式英语：The city has 1200 mm rain every year. 纠正：The city recorded an annual rainfall of 1200 millimeters.
